If you're looking for a suspenseful thriller with intriguing characters and a captivating plot, I would highly recommend "The Silence of the Lambs." Starring Anthony Hopkins as the infamous Dr. Hannibal Lecter, it's a chilling tale that combines elements of crime and psychology.

Alternatively, if you enjoy legal thrillers with a hint of romance, "The Pelican Brief" might be right up your alley. Starring Julia Roberts and Denzel Washington, it's a suspenseful film about a law student uncovering a government conspiracy.

Based on your preference for thrillers, I'd highly recommend "Unstoppable" and "Law Abiding Citizen".

In "Unstoppable", you'll find an exciting story about a runaway train that two men (including Denzel Washington) must bring under control. On the other hand, "Law Abiding Citizen" is a gripping tale about a man taking matters into his own hands after a plea bargain sets one of his family's killers free, starring Gerard Butler. Both movies offer suspenseful and engaging narratives. Enjoy!

Given your preference for law-related films, I'd highly recommend "Taken" (2008). It's a gripping thriller about a father stopping at nothing to save his daughter from kidnappers. Liam Neeson delivers an exceptional performance in this action-packed movie.

If you're interested in a more contemporary take on justice, you might also enjoy "You" (2014), a thought-provoking drama exploring the moral implications of the right to bear arms.

Based on your interest in "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon", I'd like to recommend "Unleashed" starring Jet Li and Morgan Freeman. This action-drama film tells a compelling story of a man enslaved by the mob who seeks freedom and redemption.

If you're open to exploring a classic adaptation, you might also enjoy "The Great Gatsby" (2013) starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Carey Mulligan, and Tobey Maguire. It's a captivating portrayal of the American Dream in the Roaring Twenties. Enjoy your movie time!
